      static void fileProperties​(java.lang.String fileName)
      The fileProperties method prints details about the currently selected file.
      Properties include: if the file already exists, size (bytes), is readable / writable, if it is a file or directory, if it's hidden, the absolute path, and last modified time.

      The printFileContents method prints the text from the currently selected file.
      This method will print a line of '#' symbols, then print the contents of the selected file, then print another line of '#'.

    • Method Detail

      • printMenu

        public static int printMenu​(java.util.Scanner kb,
                            java.lang.String fileName)
                     throws java.lang.Exception
        The printMenu method prompts the user for a menu choice.
        This method returns an integer
        If input other than an integer is entered, the program will not crash. Instead it will handle the exception gracefully and prompt the user to enter an integer. If the user enters an integer outside of the valid range, the menu is reprompted from main.
        Menu choices are:

        1) Enter a file name
        2) Print the file properties
        3) Print the file contents
        4) Write to a file
        5) Quit

        Note: The input buffer will be left cleared before leaving the method
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner to the keyboard
        fileName - Representing the name of the file
        Returns:
        int Representing the menu choice chosen
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Scanner is null
        java.lang.Exception - part of the method signature - if an exception occurs inside the body of this method it is thrown up the call stack

      • readFileName

        public static java.lang.String readFileName​(java.util.Scanner kb,
                                            java.lang.String fileName)
                                     throws java.lang.Exception
        The readFileName method asks the user to enter a file name. This represents the currently selected file.

        Note: The input buffer will be left cleared before leaving the method
        Parameters:
        kb - Representing the Scanner to the keyboard
        fileName - Representing the name of the current file
        Returns:
        String representing the user-selected file name
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the Scanner is null
        java.lang.Exception - part of the method signature - if an exception occurs inside the body of this method it is thrown up the call stack

      • fileProperties

        public static void fileProperties​(java.lang.String fileName)
                           throws java.lang.Exception
        The fileProperties method prints details about the currently selected file.
        Properties include: if the file already exists, size (bytes), is readable / writable, if it is a file or directory, if it's hidden, the absolute path, and last modified time.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Representing the name of the current file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the fileName is null. Note: throws this exception if the String object is null, not if the fileName is named "null"
        java.lang.Exception - part of the method signature - if an exception occurs inside the body of this method it is thrown up the call stack

      • printFileContents

        public static void printFileContents​(java.lang.String fileName)
                              throws java.lang.Exception
        The printFileContents method prints the text from the currently selected file.
        This method will print a line of '#' symbols, then print the contents of the selected file, then print another line of '#'. The new lines in the file will be preserved in the print out.
        Parameters:
        fileName - Representing the name of the current file
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the fileName is null. Note: throws this exception if the String object is null, not if the fileName is named "null"
        java.lang.Exception - part of the method signature - if an exception occurs inside the body of this method it is thrown up the call stack

      • writeToFile

        public static void writeToFile​(java.lang.String fileName,
                               java.util.Scanner kb)
                        throws java.lang.Exception
        The writeToFile method will write text to the currently selected file.
        It will first check if the currently selected file exists or not. If it already exists, ask the user if they want to overwrite the file and continue, otherwise the method doesn't do anything and the menu is printed again from main.

        The user will continully enter Strings until the stopword "STOP" is given on it's own line. The Strings entered by the user will be written to the current file with their line formats intact.

        Note: The input buffer will be left cleared before leaving the method
        Parameters:
        fileName - Representing the name of the current file
        kb - Representing the Scanner to the keyboard
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the fileName is null. Note: throws this exception if the String object is null, not if the fileName is named "null"
        java.lang.Exception - part of the method signature - if an exception occurs inside the body of this method it is thrown up the call stack
